column3: description

Medium and smaller targets are swallowed whole with an MoS of 30+. Engulfed victims suffer the effects of acid spit (below) until freed or dead and cannot see, hear, or breathe (see Asphyxiation, p. 194, EP).
DV 1d10 + 5 per turn for 3 Action Turns. Armor defends but is decreased by the damage.
Bite targets may be subdued (p. 204, EP) with a Quick Action.
No defense, 10 meter radius effect, when underwater.
Struck targets must make a SOM x 3 Test or be knocked down.
On subsequent actions, entangled victims will be grabbed by other bolatees and torn apart, inflicting DV 2d10 (armor does not protect).
On subsequent actions, entangled victims will be grabbed by other bolatees and torn apart, inflicting DV 2d10 (armor does not protect).
Subdued targets are penetrated and converted on next action.
DV 1d10 per Action Turn to touched/penetrated targets. Damage inflicted increases creeper's DUR.
No defense, 30 meter radius effect, kinetic armor applies. All physical things pushed back 1d10 meters, SOM x 3 Test or knocked down.
Struck victims must make a SOM x 3 Test or be knocked down
Subdued biomorphs take DV 2d10 per Action Turn (armor does not protect); subdued synthmorphs may be incapacitated with the disabler.

Toxin: Inhalation, Onset Time: 1 Action Turn, Duration: 5 turns/2 hours; victims suffer severe coughing and respiratory distress, DV 1d10 per turn for 5 Action Turns, −20 to all actions for 2 hours; medichines reduce DV by half and modifier duration to 15 minutes.

Toxin: Inhalation, Onset Time: 1 Action Turn, Duration: 5 turns/2 hours; victims suffer severe coughing and respiratory distress, DV 1d10 per turn for 5 Action Turns, −20 to all actions for 2 hours; medichines reduce DV by half and modifier duration to 15 minutes.
Struck targets may be subdued with a Quick Action (p. 204, EP)

Poison: Injected, Onset Time: 1 Action Turn, Duration 1 Action Turn/10 minutes, victims take DV 2d10 + 5 and are incapacitated with convulsions; a SOM x 3 Test halves the damage and replaces convulsions with a −20 modifier to all actions. Medichines reduce the duration by half.

Toxin: Inhalation, Onset Time: 1 Action Turn, Duration: 5 turns/2 hours; victims suffer severe coughing and respiratory distress, DV 1d10 per turn for 5 Action Turns, −20 to all actions for 2 hours; medichines reduce DV by half and modifier duration to 15 minutes.
These weapons only work for Factors. May be set to self-destruct, inflicting DV 8d10 + 10, AP −8, blast area effect.
On an MoS of 30+ targets are impaled (treat as subdual, p. 204, EP) and injected with defiler eggs.
Additional DV 1d10 every turn for 3 additional Action Turns. Kinetic armor applies, but the AV is reduced by the DV absorbed. Usable once per 12 hours.

Medium and smaller targets are swallowed whole with an MoS of 30+. Engulfed victims suffer the effects of acid spit (below) until freed or dead and cannot see, hear, or breathe (see Asphyxiation, p. 194, EP).
DV 1d10 + 5 per turn for 3 Action Turns. Armor defends but is decreased by the damage.
The troll may take a fractal gouge attack against subdued targets with a Quick Action.
On a critical failure the weapon autotargets the nearest three individuals or machines, attacks each with a skill of 60, and inflicts a shock effect and DV 1d10 on the freak (p. 204, EP).

Bite targets may be subdued (p. 204, EP) with a Quick Action. Medium and smaller targets are swallowed on the next action. Swallowed victims cannot see, hear, or breathe (p. 204, EP), are restricted (−30 to all actions), and suffer DV 2d10 per Action Turn (armor does not apply). An eel that takes 2 wounds internally regurgitates anything swallowed on its next action.
No defense, 10 meter radius effect, when underwater.
If the MoS exceeds the target's Durability, they are subdued (p. 204, EP) and take 3d10 DV per Action Turn (armor does not protect).
If a target is subdued, the gut eater will attempt to force its way down the victim’s throat on its next action.
If the MoS exceeds the target’s Durability, they are blinded and subdued (see Subdual, p. 204, EP).
A hollow’s nano plasma can corrode matter like a disassembler swarm (p. 329, EP), inflicting DV 1d10 per Action Turn.
May increase damage +1d10 DV per shot by consuming 1 extra ammo, up to a maximum of +5d10 DV.
Biomorphs wounded by this bite are infected with the glory exsurgent virus (p. 175).

On the second turn of subdual, the target is completely enveloped. Engulfed victims take double damage from the caustic coating, cannot see, hear, or breathe (Asphyxiation, p. 194, EP), and are restricted (−30 to all physical actions). Engulfed characters that beat the jelly in an Opposed SOM x 3 Test with the −30 modifier return to being normally subdued.

Subdued targets are swallowed on next action. Swallowed victims cannot see, hear, or breathe (Asphyxiation, p. 194, EP), are restricted (–30 to physical actions), and suffer DV 1d10 each Action Turn; armor defends but is decreased by the damage.
Additional DV 1d10 every turn for 3 additional Action Turns. Kinetic armor applies, but the AV is reduced by the DV absorbed. Usable once per day.
Latches onto head or extremity with an MoS of 30+ (treat as subdual, p. 204, EP). Claw/bite attacks while latched on receive a +30 to hit and inflict +2d10 DV.
Necrosis nanotoxin: injected, Onset: 3 Action Turns, Duration: 1 minute, inflicts DV (1d10 ÷ 2) per Action Turn, see p. 324, EP.

Synthmorphs take half damage (round down). Biomorph targets that take at least 5 damage must make a SOM x 2 Test or be overcome with pain (negated by Pain Tolerance), taking no other actions but to flee or remove worms for the next 10 minutes, and will continue to take DV 1d10 (armor does not apply) each Action Turn until the attached worms are removed. Removing the worms requires 4 Complex Actions (others may assist), during which the victim must remain free from the swarm (else it resets), and inflicts DV 1d10 + 2 (armor does not apply).

On the second turn of subdual, the target is completely enveloped. Engulfed victims take double damage from the caustic coating, cannot see, hear, or breathe (Asphyxiation, p. 194, EP), and are restricted (−30 to all physical actions). Engulfed characters that beat the jelly in an Opposed SOM x 3 Test with the −30 modifier return to being normally subdued.
If the MoS exceeds the target’s Durability, they are blinded and subdued (see Subdual, p. 204, EP).
Twitch Toxin: Injected, Onset: 3 Action Turns, Duration: 10 minutes (5 with medichines). Targets make a SOM Test (+20 with medichines).
On next action puppet will make a called shot on target's access jacks to plug in a disabler or a direct fiberoptic link to initiate a brainhack.
On next action puppet will make a called shot on target's access jacks to plug in a disabler or a direct fiberoptic link to initiate a brainhack.
On an MoS of 30+ targets are impaled (treat as subdual, p. 204, EP) and injected with defiler eggs.
Additional DV 1d10 every turn for 3 additional Action Turns. Kinetic armor applies, but the AV is reduced by the DV absorbed. Usable once per 12 hours.
Target’s Fray is halved. Further melee attacks by the swarm ignore armor.
Target’s Fray is halved. The swarm harries a target by clustering around eyes and orifices, buzzing around, etc. The target suffers a −10 modifier to all actions (−30 if MoS is 30+).

Toxin: Injected, Onset: 1 Action Turn, Duration: 2 minutes/6 hours (medichines reduce by half), victims suffer incapacitating seizures for 2 minutes followed by active hallucinations for 6 hours. Hallucinating characters act completely randomly/are under GM control. A SOM x 2 Test negates the seizures and reduces the intensity of the hallucinations to a −20 modifier to all actions.
Two slouches may direct their Bessel beams at the same target, one pulling, one repulsing, to create a devastating shearing effect.
Medium-sized and smaller targets only
These bots are suicide bombers.
Strikes all targets within 2 meters of the stalker simultaneously.
On an MoS of 30+, target is subdued (p. 204, EP).

With an MoS of 30+ the target is knocked down and 
pinned to the ground (see Subdual, p. 204, EP).

Toxin: Injected, Onset: 1 Action Turn, Duration: 6 Action Turns (3 with medichines), victims lose 5 points of SOM per Action Turn. Each turn the victim may make a SOM Test to negate the SOM loss and further effects. If SOM is reduced to zero, the character is paralyzed. SOM loss returns at the rate of 1 point per hour.
Switchwings can move their full Running rate and dive attack with no additional modifiers.
Toxin: Injected, Onset: 1 minute, Duration: 1 hour (30 minutes with medichines), victims take DV 2d10 from internal bleeding every ten minutes.

Ignores armor with an MoS of 30+, blast area effect, −2 DV per meter. If the target’s Wound Threshold and/or Armor Value exceed 10, the mine will detonate an additional charge (for each). Each mine carries 6 charges. Extra charges are ejected. For every 2 wounds inflicted, there is a 20% chance of a crippled or amputated limb; victims losing legs move at a quarter their normal movement rate until healed or repaired (pp. 208 and 327, EP).

With 30+ MoS target is subdued (p. 204, EP). On further actions, biomorphs are strangled; each turn they take DV 1d10 (no defense) and must make a SOM x 3 Test or fall unconscious. Apply a cumulative −10 modifier to each test after the first.
Each vydra head may attack separately with the same action. If the MoS exceeds the target’s Durability, they are subdued (p. 204, EP).
If the vydra achieves a MoS equal to the AV x 2 or more, it rips off a chunk of protection. Reduce the target’s AV values by 1d10 + 2.
Target must make a SOM x 3 Test or be knocked down.
If the MoS exceeds the target’s Durability, they are subdued (p. 204, EP).
If the MoS exceeds the target’s Durability, they are subdued, as with the feeding tendril above.

On its next action, medium and smaller subdued targets are swallowed. Swallowed victims cannot see, hear, or breathe (Asphyxiation, p. 194, EP), are restricted (−30 to physical actions), and suffer DV 1d10 per Action Turn (armor does not apply). A whiplash that takes 2 wounds internally will regurgitate anything swallowed on its next action.
After subduing a victim with its tendril, the whiplash will raise and drop them on each subsequent action (without letting go), until the target no longer struggles, before swallowing.
If MoS exceeds target’s Durability, they are subdued (see Subdual, p. 204, EP).
Target must make a REF x 3 Test or be incapacitated in quick-hardening foam (Armor 10/Durability 20) for 12 hours.
If loper moved at least 5 meters before attack and MoS exceeds target’s Durability, the target is knocked down and pinned (Subdual, p. 204, EP).
With an MoS of 30+, target is snared around neck. Attempts to move will result in DV 1d10 ÷ 2 (round down, armor does not protect) and asphyxiation (p. 194, EP).

Large and smaller targets are swallowed whole with an MoS of 30+. Swallowed victims take DV 1d10 per 
minute; armor protects but is reduced by damage.

Struck targets that are medium or larger sized may be 
subdued (p. 204, EP) with a Quick Action.
Damaged characters must make a DUR x 2 Test (+30 with medichines) or become infected by the protist pathogen.
Damaged characters must make a DUR x 2 Test (+30 with medichines) or become infected by the protist pathogen.
